intro: Hecatostemon, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Hecatostemon has heart-shaped leaves and produces vines that can climb or trail along the ground. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
